caption.p: A patient with pancreatic cancer and synchronous liver metastases, who was treated with systemic GC HAI FUDR. (A) CT images showing the presence of pancreatic cancer (yellow arrows indicate) and synchronous liver metastases (red arrows indicate) at baseline. (B) CT images show primary cancer and liver metastases are shrinking at 6 months. (C) images show sustained response of liver metastases and primary cancer. (D) Hepatic arteriography shows HAI pump functionality at 12 months (purple arrow indicates side hole of the catheter; gold arrow indicates the tip of the catheter, which was located in the occluded gastroduodenal artery).
